activity_1_b.text:
Listen and repeat.
සවන් දී වචන නැවත කියන්න.
கேட்டு மீண்டும் சொல்லுங்கள்.

activity_1_d.text:
Listen and repeat.
සවන් දී වාක්‍ය නැවත කියන්න.
கேட்டு மீண்டும் சொல்லுங்கள்.

activity_1_e.text:
Read along.
පිටපත සමඟ කියවන්න.
ஒரே நேரத்தில் வாசியுங்கள்.

content.sentence_text: This cl'u'tch was hard to press.
Those b'u'ses were full of passengers last week.
There were five men in a large tr'u'ck here yesterday.

example.text:
Listen to the model dialogue.
ආදර්ශ සංවාදයට සවන් දෙන්න.
மாதிரி உரையாடலை கேளுங்கள்.

activity_2_a.text:
Match the words with the pictures.
පදයන් පින්තූර සමග ගැලපන්න.
சொற்களைப் படங்களுடன் பொருத்துங்கள்.

activity_2_c.text:
Listen and repeat.
සවන් දී වාක්‍ය නැවත කියන්න.
கேட்டு மீண்டும் சொல்லுங்கள்.

activity_2_d.text:
Read along.
පිටපත සමඟ කියවන්න.
ஒரே நேரத்தில் வாசியுங்கள்.

activity_2_e.text:
Listen to each question, use the pause to answer it, then compare your response with the model answer.
සෑම ප්‍රශ්නයකටම සවන් දෙන්න, පිළිතුරු දීමට විරාමය භාවිතා කරන්න, ඉන්පසු ඔබේ පිළිතුර ආදර්ශ පිළිතුර සමඟ සසඳන්න.
ஒவ்வொரு கேள்வியையும் கேட்டு, இடைவெளியைப் பயன்படுத்தி பதிலளியுங்கள். பின்னர் உங்கள் பதிலை மாதிரி பதிலுடன் ஒப்பிடுங்கள்.

example_dialogues.text_a: Was the principal happy with the lecture?
example_dialogues.text_b: No, he wasn’t. He was unhappy.
No, it wasn’t. It was sour.
No, they weren’t. They were wet.

dialogues.text_b: No, I wasn’t. I was rested.

dialogues.text_a: Were the trainees on time for the school bus?
dialogues.text_b: No, they weren’t. They were late.

dialogues.text_a: Was the instructor satisfied with our work yesterday?
dialogues.text_b: No, he wasn’t. He was disappointed.
No, it wasn’t. It was hot.

dialogues.text_a: Was the food tasty at the school canteen last week?
dialogues.text_b: No, it wasn’t. It was awful.
No, they weren’t. They were cheerful.

activity_a.text:
Remember we often use these or similar time markers in the sentences in the Simple Past Tense. 
අපි සාමාන්‍ය භූත කාලයේ වාක්‍යවලදී මෙම හෝ සමාන කාල සලකුණු බොහෝ විට භාවිතා කරන බව මතක තබා ගන්න.
நாம் சாதாரண கடந்த கால வாக்கியங்களில் இந்த அல்லது இதர நேர குறியீடுகளை அடிக்கடி பயன்படுத்துவதை நினைவில் கொள்ளுங்கள்.

activity_b.text:
Choose the correct form of the verb 'to be'. Use the past tense only when the time markers clearly indicate that the action happened in the past.
ක්‍රියා පදය 'to be' හි නිවැරදි ආකාරය තෝරන්න. කාල සලකුණු පැහැදිලිව ක්‍රියාව භූත කාලයේ සිදු වූ බව පෙන්වන්නේ නම් පමණක් භූත කාලය භාවිතා කරන්න.
வினைச்சொல் 'to be' இன் சரியான வடிவத்தைத் தேர்ந்தெடுக்கவும். நேர குறியீடுகள் நடவடிக்கை கடந்த காலத்தில் நடந்தது என்பதை தெளிவாகக் காட்டும் போது மட்டுமே கடந்த காலத்தைப் பயன்படுத்தவும்.

content.sentence: The safety officer ___  always responsible for checking all warning signs at SLGTI.
The trainees ___ very attentive during the inspection yesterday morning.
The technical instructors ___ usually very strict about protective clothing.
The technical officer ___ in the restricted zone two days ago.
The trainees in all 6 sections ___ always very careful when handling flammable substances.
The maintenance workers are busy because the alarm system ___ faulty last night.
The storekeeper ___ responsible for keeping all safety equipment in order.
The heads of departments ___ satisfied with the installation of the new warning systems last May.
The demonstrators ___ in the workshop when the emergency signal was first tested in 2023.
The Principal ___ disappointed because the procedures were not followed correctly during tests three weeks ago.

activity_a.text:
Listen to the audio which will be played twice and click on the correct answer. It is very important that you read the questions before you listen to the recording.
ඔබට සෑම පටිගත කිරීමක්ම දෙවරක් ඇසෙනු ඇත. නිවැරදි පිළිතුර ක්ලික් කරන්න. රෙකෝඩින් එක අහන්නට පෙර ප්‍රශ්නය කියවීම ඉතාමත් වැදගත්ය.
ஒவ்வொரு ஒலிப்பதிவையும் நீங்கள் இருமுறை கேட்கலாம். கேட்ட எண்களை குறித்து எழுதுங்கள். பதிவைக் கேட்பதற்கு முன் கேள்விகளைப் படிப்பது மிகவும் முக்கியம்.

activity_c.text:
Listen and repeat.
සවන් දී වාක්‍ය නැවත කියන්න.
கேட்டு மீண்டும் சொல்லுங்கள்.

activity_d.text: Read along. පිටපත සමඟ කියවන්න. ஒரே நேரத்தில் வாசியுங்கள்.

Questions.question: Why are safety goggles important?
Questions.answer: Because they protect the eyes from sharp tools
options: Because they protect the eyes from sharp tools
Because they are easy to carry

Questions.question: What is the instructor checking in the workshop?
Questions.answer: If the trainees are wearing safety boots
options: If the trainees are wearing safety boots
If the trainees are reading books
If the trainees are using computers

Questions.question: Why is one trainee not safe in the workshop?
Questions.answer: He is wearing light sandals instead of safety boots
options: He is not speaking to the instructor
He is wearing light sandals instead of safety boots
He is holding a reflective vest

Questions.question: What routine in the food laboratory reduces risks?
Why are trainees wearing insulated gloves and rubber boots in the electrical section?
Questions.answer: Because they make their work safe
options: Because they make their work safe

activity_b.text: Safety equipment is not optional; it is essential because accidents can happen quickly.
A clean safety helmet is near the entrance.
Bright reflective vests are on the table.
Safety goggles are in the drawer, but some students are not wearing them because they believe the task is easy.
They are using sharp tools, and they must protect their eyes.
He is checking if trainees are wearing heavy safety boots.
Another trainee is using a noisy machine without ear protectors.
The muffs are in his bag, but he is not putting them on because he is in a hurry.
In the food laboratory, clean hair nets are very important.
In the electrical section, trainees are wearing insulated gloves and rubber boots.
They are not touching live wires because it is extremely dangerous.
Safety rules are clear: wear the right equipment, follow instructions, and stay alert.

activity_c.text: Safety equipment is not optional; it is essential because accidents can happen quickly.
A clean safety helmet is near the entrance.

They are using sharp tools, and they must protect their eyes.
He is checking if trainees are wearing heavy safety boots.

In the food laboratory, clean hair nets are very important.

They are not touching live wires because it is extremely dangerous.
Safety rules are clear: wear the right equipment, follow instructions, and stay alert.

activity_d.text_a: There is a pair of leather gloves on the shelf.
activity_d.text_b: There are some leather gloves on the shelf.

activity_d.text_a: There is a pair of scissors on the table.
activity_d.text_b: There are some scissors on the table.

activity_d.text_a: There is a pair of boots under the bench.
activity_d.text_b: There are some boots under the bench.

activity_d.text_a: There is a pair of ear protectors in the bag.
activity_d.text_b: There are some ear protectors in the bag.

activity_d.text_a: There is a pair of pliers on the workbench.
activity_d.text_b: There are some pliers on the workbench.
